text: Another q, is it possible for me to move the templates/modules that i did on sandbox to another main paid account? kinda like migrating the whole site to another account?
You can install <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/hubx-by-neambo/dmgpiodabbkeicgkhpokecnlpjddjmah> which allows you to right click on modules and copy them to a new portal ( account )
in email drag-and-drop templates, why does all the padding (inner spacing) i set for a module group disappear on mobile?

Proper padding support in email is not crazy consistent. but since you said mobile, you likely have a media query affecting the padding on mobile. If you are using a template you did not create, odds are the template has a media query to reduce the padding on mobile to make better use of the screen realestate
thanks, Jon. nope — no media queries. i go from this, at 600px …
… to this at 480px.
looks good enough for government work (joking)
lol
if you shoot me the preview url i could take a brief look
i'm working for artists. :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-previewer/5586161/templates/8776345265>
like that?
ahh no, it’d have to be from the email “page editor” like screen
that preview url i can’t access because it requires login
sorry. :flushed:
lol np
<https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=true&portalId=5586161&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_layout_id=8776345265&updated=1554921393770>
yep - there’s a media query in there killing padding on ya
<https://spin.d.pr/9zzwxz+>
NO
:slightly_smiling_face: oh, i get it. yes. it's a baked-in one. thought you were referring to one i added.
if you don’t have access to edit those styles you’ll need to override them
i'm leery of changing global settings in the client's account, but i'll override 'em. thanks for taking a look, Jon, and confirming that that's the correct course to take.
yeah no i wouldn’t change global settings for emails(I hate those settings even existing) I’d just add a style tag with your overriding css to the head of the email template
and that "NO" was a "how could i have missed that" kind of NO. :slightly_smiling_face:
thanks again, Jon. i'll make it happen.

Hi folks, been working first HubSpot cms website for a few months now and its up in the world! (<http://samasource.com|samasource.com>). However, now I am onto getting the blog in working order. Using local dev environment to get markupand stylin down. Wondering specifically where does the dummy data for blog posts get pulled in from so I can use hubl tags in my local setup?

for example I used the {{ content.name }} tag which returns "My Blog" but I can't seem to find that in any of the conf/context/* files. maybe I am missing something...
